Sure, here is a sample three-day tour plan in Baoji, adopting driving as the mode of transportation:

Day 1:
10:00 AM - 12:00 PM: Visit the Baoji Bronze Museum. You can drive to the museum, which is located in the city center. The drive takes about 15 minutes.
1:00 PM - 2:00 PM: Have lunch at a local restaurant. There are many restaurants near the museum that serve traditional Shaanxi cuisine.
2:00 PM - 4:00 PM: Visit People's Park. You can drive from the museum to the park, which is located in the city center. The drive takes about 10 minutes.
4:00 PM - 6:00 PM: Visit the Han Yangling Mausoleum. You can drive from the park to the mausoleum, which is located about 30 minutes from the city center.
7:00 PM - 8:30 PM: Enjoy a traditional Shaanxi performance or show. There are many theaters and performance venues in Baoji that offer traditional Shaanxi music and dance performances. You can drive to reach the theater.

Day 2:
9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Visit the Terracotta Warriors Museum. You can drive from the city center to the museum, which is located about 45 minutes away.
11:00 AM - 12:00 PM: Visit the Han Great Wall Museum. You can drive from the museum to the museum, which is located in the city center. The drive takes about 15 minutes.
1:00 PM - 2:00 PM: Have lunch at a local restaurant.
2:00 PM - 4:00 PM: Visit the Qishan Mountain Scenic Area. You can drive from the city center to the scenic area, which is located about 45 minutes away.

Day 3:
9:00 AM - 10:00 AM: Visit the Baoji Taoist Temple. You can drive from the city center to the temple, which is located about 30 minutes away.
11:00 AM - 12:00 PM: Visit the Baoji Confucius Temple. You can drive from the temple to the temple, which is located in the city center. The drive takes about 15 minutes.
1:00 PM - 2:00 PM: Have lunch at a local restaurant.
2:00 PM - 4:00 PM: Visit the Baoji Museum of Han Stone Sculptures. You can drive from the city center to the museum, which is located about 30 minutes away.

This plan assumes you will be taking a 2-hour lunch break each day, which is a common practice in China. The exact schedule can be adjusted based on your interests, energy levels, and other factors. You can also add or remove activities based on your preferences, or extend your visits at any of the destinations.

Please note that these are just suggestions and can be adjusted based on your specific needs and interests. Additionally, the opening and closing times of the attractions, the performance schedules, and the road conditions may change, so it's best to check in advance or with your hotel to confirm.
